alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 29 at 2:34AM PST until December 30 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 20 to 25 feet are possible through the rest of the week. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast, which includes all beaches of Curry, Coos, and Douglas Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Extremely large breaking waves will create very hazardous conditions along beaches and area shorelines. Waves will inundate beaches and surge into normally dry areas. Infrastructure damage and significant beach erosion can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...King-tides are expected during this time and this will increase the inundation of beaches and increase the risk of beach erosion. Gusty winds over all waters on Friday will sustain hazardous shoreline conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Beaches and coastlines will become hazardous due to very large and life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of beaches, rocks, jetties,piers, and other waterside infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
